text: Human MHC class II gene transcription directed by the carboxyl terminus of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , one of the defective genes in type II MHC combined immune deficiency .

Type II major histocompatibility complex combined immune deficiency ( type II MHC CID or bare lymphocyte syndrome ) is a congenital immunodeficiency disease characterized by absent MHC class II expression .
Four distinct complementation groups have been identified .
Recently , the defective gene in group II type II MHC CID has been isolated and termed <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Here , we demonstrate that <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an MHC class II gene - specific transcription activator .

The transcription activation function is provided by the N-terminal acidic domain ( amino acids 26-137 ) , which is experimentally exchangeable with a heterologous viral transcription - activating domain .

The specificity of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for three major MHC class II genes , DR , DQ and DP , is mediated by its remaining C-terminal residues ( amino acids 317-1130 ) .

The transactivation of multiple cis elements , especially S and X2 , of the <extra_id_0> DR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter in group II CID cells is <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dependent .

text: Since <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> overexpression in normal cells did not increase class II expression , we propose that initiation of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression serves as the on-off switch , while availability of downstream interactor ( s ) limits transcription .
